Wolfblade::

She watched him walk away. Part of her spark was over joyed. Part of
her spark knew that inside the base was the worst kind of hell that
any bot could endure.  She start to feel sick to her ingestion
compartments. She felt like she was saving one to betray another.  but
she couldn't figure out whom she was saving and whom she was
betraying.  She let the weight of her body go and dropped to her
knees. Never had she wished for him to do this. Though she felt
overwhelming happiness that she was the one he had choosen. She also
felt sick for the one who was about to be hurt.  She felt like she was
a traiter to a fellow warrior bot in arms. She wondered how in the pit
she would live with herself after all this.  Part of her spark hoped
he ment when he said they would go away from here. After this day,
living here would not be an option to her. And she knew it.   




--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> wrote:
> Malice:
>  
> "I'll be alright.  Don't worry about me.  As for you being weak," he
said, lifting her face up to meet his," You are far stronger than
many.  You stay here, I will try not to be long."
>  
> He smiled and placed a small kiss on her cheek and turned to head
inside.  To see if his spark could handle what he had to do.
>
